intro: Anartia glabrata, commonly known as the glabrous swallowtail, is a species of butterfly found in South America. It belongs to the family Papilionidae and is characterized by its distinctive black and yellow wing patterns. The larvae of this species feed on plants in the genus Erythroxylum, which are part of the nightshade family. The adult butterflies are often seen in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its life cycle is closely tied to the availability of its host plants, making it an important indicator of ecosystem health.
